entries.name: Endurance
entries: If you have no Exhaustion, you can use this trait to avoid gaining a level of Exhaustion. You regain the use of this trait on a long rest. {@note 6}

entries.name: Creativity
entries: When making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw, you can gain advantage on the roll. You can choose to do this after the roll has been made but before the result is declared. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus - 1 per long rest. {@note 6}

entries.name: Artisan's Lore
entries: Whenever you make an Intelligence (History) check related to the origin or history of an item related to an artisan tool with which you are proficient, you are considered proficient in the History skill and add double your Proficiency Bonus to the check, instead of your normal Proficiency Bonus. {@note 0}

entries.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency with the artisan's tools of your choice. {@note 1}

entries.name: Skilled Artistry
entries: The time it takes to craft something using an artisan's tool with which you are proficient is halved. {@note 2}
Ever since the arrival of goblins on Eora, the dwarves been locked in constant struggle with them.

sizeEntry.name: Size:
entries: Medium (about 6-8 feet tall)

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

sizeEntry.name: Size:
entries: Small (about 3-4 feet tall)

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only in a monochromatic shade of gray. {@note 3}

entries.name: Biter
entries: You have a mouthful of sharp teeth that allow you to make damaging unarmed strikes as a natural weapon. When you hit with it, the strike deals 1d6 + Strength modifier slashing damage. {@note 1}

entries.name: Combat Awareness
entries: If you are surprised in battle, enemies do not have advantage against you in the surprise round. {@note 0}

entries.name: Out of Sight
entries: You can attempt to hide even when you are obscured only by a creature that is at least one size larger than you. {@note 1}

entries.name: Artisan
entries: You gain proficiency with the artisan's tools of your choice. {@note 1}

entries.name: Ambush
entries: If you hit a creature with an attack roll, the creature takes an extra 2d6 damage if it hasn't taken a turn yet in the current combat. {@note 5}

entries.name: Nimble Escape
entries: You can take the {@action Disengage} or {@action Hide} action as a bonus action on each of your turns. {@note 7}

Goblinoids are an alien species and while are not kith are similar in body plan and structure. The multiple forms of goblinoid are life stages of a single species that reproduces hermaphroditically with larvae. These spawning pools are considered vile to most kith, mostly due to the smell, but more practically as a source of disease and vermin. While not all goblinoids are evil, their societies and cultures are significantly more chaotic, violent, and competitive than kith. While goblinoids do *rarely* join other societies, they will live on the fringes of settlements or in completely separate societies of their own.

Their fast metabolisms make goblins eating machines stricken with almost constant hunger; fortunately, goblins can subsist on almost anything organic, including other humanoids. This hunger subsides as they evolve. Combined with their tendency to scavenge and lay waste to local food sources causes most societies to view them as pests, outcasts, or annoyances at best. In rare occasions, befriending goblins has often led to great technological innovations and strategic military alliances.
Many kith call them "biters." Some consider goblins the "teeth in the night" that break into isolated farmhouses and steal babies, or devour entire cows in the field leaving bloody bones and scraps.

entries.name: Constructed Form
entries: You are a Construct. You don't need to eat, drink, or breathe, and magic can't put you to sleep. You are immune to disease and have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition paralyzed}. {@note 4}

entries.name: Vigilant Rest
entries: When you take a long rest, you can spend at least six hours in an inactive, motionless state, rather than sleeping. In this state, you appear inert, but it doesn't render you unconscious, and you can see and hear as normal. {@note 2}

entries.name: Swim Speed
entries: You have a swim speed of 30 feet. {@note 2}

entries.name: Amphibious
entries: You can breathe both air and water. {@note 2}

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only in monochromatic shades of brown or green. {@note 3}

entries.name: Wildtongue
entries: You speak primordial (giant). {@note 0}

entries.name: Speech of Beast and Leaf
entries: You have the ability to communicate in a limited manner with Beasts, Plants, and vegetation. They can understand the meaning of your words, though you have no special ability to understand them in return. You have advantage on all Charisma checks you make to influence them. {@note 2}

entries.name: Traversal
entries: You can move across difficult terrain caused by Plant creatures and vegetation without spending extra movement. {@note 0}

Nature godlike are manifestations of nature. Most have plantlike growths such as mossy or flowering vines for hair, barklike skin, or saplike blood. Some bear mammalian animal features such as horns or antlers, long cervine-like ears, tails, fur, or hooved legs. Their eyes, as with other godlike, feature solid glowing irises and/or pupils - in variants of green, blue, yellow and brown.

entries.name: Sources of their power
items: Dryads, hags, archfey and other creatures from the feywilds

entries.name: Description
entries: You stand between 3 and 8 feet tall and weigh between 40 and 200 pounds. Osphrani mature at 12 and can live up to 60 years.

entries.name: Strong Kick
entries: Your strong legs and tail allow you to make damaging unarmed strikes as light weapons while balancing on your tail. When you hit with it, a strike deals 1d6 + Strength modifier bludgeoning damage. The target of your attack must make a Strength saving throw (DC 10 + your Strength bonus) or be pushed back 5 feet. {@note 2}

entries.name: Leap
entries: Your long jump is 20 feet and your high jump is 10 feet, with or without a running start. {@note 2}

entries.name: Quick
entries: Your base walking speed is 35 feet. {@note 2}

entries.name: Agile Fall
entries: When you fall 100 feet or less and aren't {@condition incapacitated}, you can make a DC 10 Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check when you land. If you succeed, you take no falling damage and land on your feet. {@note 3}

entries.name: Pouch
entries: All osphrani have a pouch on their belly can either carry one item weighing up to their Strength score, or can serve as a component pouch. You cannot use this feature if your belly is covered or otherwise inaccessible, however most armouries supply armour that accommodates this feature. You have advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand}) checks you make to conceal an object in your pouch. {@note 1}

entries.name: Bounding
entries: As a bonus action, you can jump a number of feet equal to five times your proficiency bonus, without provoking opportunity attacks. You can use this trait only if your speed is greater than 0. You can use it a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
Additionally, the efficiency of movement your bounding provides means you can move twice the normal time (up to 16 hours) each day before being subject to the effects of a forced march. {@note 4}
Ysoki is the collective name for a number of rodent and marsupial-like mammalian species. They are generally small mammalian species, most commonly resembling rats, mice, hare, and squirrels.

Mrrshan are a species with feline-like traits and qualities. They commonly resemble large cats of the world, but their patterns and body structures vary as much as any other humanoid.

Curious and gregarious wanderers, mrrshan have features of felines and humanoids in both appearance and temperament. They enjoy learning new things, collecting new tales and trinkets, and ensuring their loved ones are safe and happy. They view themselves as chosen guardians of natural places in the world and are often recklessly brave, even in the face of overwhelming opposition.

Mrrshan are outgoing, active humanoids who delight in discovery, whether of hidden ruins or a comfortable place to nap. They are exceptionally social, both within their tight-knit communities and with other creatures they meet. Remarkably brave, mrrshan see themselves as guardians of the world against forces that would assail it, and they believe that strong communities, breadth of experience, and continual self-improvement aid them in this fight.

They have fast reflexes and are even able to twist themselves in the air while falling to land on their feet. As quick as these reflexes are, mrrshani tempers are quicker, shifting from effusive glee to aggrieved fury in an instant.

entries.name: Pack Tactics

The khenra are typically tall and lean, with graceful bodies and heads that strongly resemble jackals, wild dogs, or foxes. Their snouts are long and sharp, and their ears rise straight above their heads. Their bodies are covered in sleek hair that tends to match their homelands. Despite their sharp teeth, they consider biting to be an uncouth and unworthy combat tactic.

Nearly every khenra is born a fraternal or identical twin, and a pair of khenra twins forms an extremely close emotional bond unknown to most others. The death of one twin in training or the trials causes a tremendous shock to the survivor, who typically grows more aggressive and foolhardy in battle. The rare khenra who are born without twins are believed to have killed their siblings in the womb, and are thus viewed as natural-born initiates, sure to achieve a glorified death in the trials.

entries.name: Primordial
entries: You speak primordial (terran).

Talos are as variant as stone, crystals, and metals that fill the planes, but they always have a physical manifestation of that form in their person. Their skin or hair is often a specific type of stone, metal, or gemstone with physical features made, seeming to be made, or partially made of that material.

Their eyes are always a solid color similar in coloration to their form and never have pupils. A talos with marble skin may have bright white eyes while one with sapphire teeth and nails may have matching sapphire eyes.
Talos godlike all have strange mercurial blood that sometimes differs in shade.

entries.name: Sources of their power
entries: The elemental plane of earth
Demigods or powerful earth-aligned creatures

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries: All gnomish characters have either Magic Resistance Greater Magic Resistance.

Long ago, early gnome ancestors emigrated from the First World, realm of the fey. While it's unclear why the first gnomes wandered to Eora, this ancestry manifests in modern gnomes as bizarre reasoning, eccentricity, obsessive tendencies, and what some see as naivete. These qualities are further reflected in their physical characteristics, such as spindly limbs, brightly colored hair, and childlike and extremely expressive facial features that further reflect their otherworldly origins.

Always hungry for new experiences, gnomes constantly wander both mentally and physically, attempting to stave off a terrible ailment that threatens all of their people. This affliction—the Bleaching—strikes gnomes who fail to dream, innovate, and take in new experiences, in the gnomes' absence of crucial magical essence from the First World.

Gnomes latch onto a source of localized magic where they live, typically primal magic, as befits their fey lineage, but this isn't enough to avoid the Bleaching unless they supplement this magic with new experiences. The Bleaching slowly drains the color—literally—from gnomes, and it plunges those affected into states of deep depression that eventually claim their lives. Very few gnomes survive this scourge, becoming deeply morose and wise survivors known as bleachlings.

entries.name: Description
entries: Most gnomes stand just over 3 feet in height and weigh little more than a human child. They exhibit a wide range of natural skin, hair, and eye colors. For gnomes that haven't begun the Bleaching, nearly any hair and eye color other than white is possible, with vibrant colors most frequent, while skin tones span a slightly narrower spectrum and tend toward earthy tones and pinkish hues, though occasionally green, black, or pale blue. Gnomes' large eyes and dense facial muscles allow them to be particularly expressive in their emotions.

entries.name: Society
entries: While most gnomes adopt some of the cultural practices of the region in which they live, they tend to pick and choose, adjusting their communities to fit their own fey logic. This often leads to majority gnome communities eventually consisting almost entirely of gnomes, as other people, bewildered by gnomish political decisions, choose to move elsewhere. Gnomes have little culture that they would consider entirely their own. No gnome kingdoms or nations exist on the surface of Eora, and gnomes wouldn't know what to do with such a state if they had one.

Your form provides ample protection, however; it gives you a base AC of 17 (your Dexterity modifier doesn't affect this number). You gain no benefit from wearing armor, but if you are using a shield, you can apply the shield's bonus as normal. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to your Proficiency Bonus, regaining all charges after a long rest. {@note 4}

entries.name: Constructed Form
entries: You are a Construct and an Ooze. You don't need to eat, drink, or breathe, and magic can't put you to sleep. You are immune to disease and have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition paralyzed}.

entries.name: Shape Self
entries: As an action, you can reshape your body to give yourself a head, one or two arms, one or two legs, and makeshift hands and feet, or you can revert to a limbless blob. While you have a humanlike shape, you can wear clothing and armor made for a Humanoid of your size.

As a bonus action, you can extrude a pseudopod that is up to 6 inches wide and 10 feet long or reabsorb it into your body. As part of the same bonus action, you can use this pseudopod to manipulate an object, open or close a door or container, or pick up or set down a Tiny object. The pseudopod contains no sensory organs and can't attack, activate magic items, or lift more than 10 pounds.

entries.name: Amorphous
entries: You have advantage on ability checks you make to initiate or escape a grapple.

entries.name: Hold Breath
entries: You can hold your breath for up to 1 hour at a time.

entries.name: Toxin Resilience
entries: You have advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the {@condition poisoned} or {@condition diseased} conditions on yourself.

entries.name: Muck Walker
entries: You ignore {@variantrule difficult terrain} caused by mud, muck, or similar terrain.

entries.name: Poison Resistance
entries: You are resistant to poison damage.

entries.name: Cantrip
entries: You know the {@spell acid burst|DiceMonstersMiscellany}, {@spell poison fang|spellsthatdontsuck}, or {@spell poison spray} cantrip.

entries.name: I've Seen Worse
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Sixth Sense
entries: You have {@sense blindsight} within a radius of 5 feet, allowing you to sense your immediate surroundings without relying on sight. This blindsight ignores full cover.

entries.name: Unexplained Ability
entries: You gain proficiency in a skill of your choice. You didn't have this skill before the Mourning. You can't explain where it came from.

Some say that the dead-gray mist began in Metrol, initially flowing out of the royal palaces of Vermishard. Others swear that the disaster began in the Cannith stronghold Making. All that is known is that the mist swiftly spread across the kingdom, transforming the lands and creatures caught within it. Over a million people died in the Mourning, including nearly all of the inhabitants of central Cyre.

entries.name: Lone Survivors
entries: While the most prominent members of this race are those who escaped the Day of Mourning in the Eberron campaign setting, these traits and tables can be used for any character that has survived any magical cataclysm in any world.

entries.name: Fuzzy Memories
entries: Most Mountoucheds' memories of the event are as hazy as the destroying mists. No definitive explanation can be found for why they were spared, but the superstitious say that these people are cursed, and that anyone touched by the Mourning is now an agent of darkness.

entries.name: Changed Forever
entries: While only a few thousand exist, many Mourntouched find it near impossible to return to a 'normal' life again. Plenty have turned to adventuring after superstitious refugees and distrusting foreigners have refused them admittance to typical society.

entries.caption: Mourning Mutations
rows: Your irises have turned jet black or stark white.
Your veins are silver and glow faintly under the light of a full moon.
You were weak, elderly, and on your deathbed when disaster struck. When you awoke, you were young and sprightly, and the people around you had been turned to glass.
Your eyes have turned to amber gemstones, with swirling veins of golden light within.
Your skin is translucent and light blue.
You appear completely identical to your previous form, but others feel strange and uncomfortable around you anyways. A detect magic spell reveals an aura of illusion magic about you.
You appear to be of a different race now.
You've grown small wings on your back. They are not large enough for flight. You may choose their appearance, such as feathery, scaly, or bat-like.
Your ears have grown elf-like points.
You have grown or shrunk 2 or more feet. You may need to change your size from Medium to Small, or vice versa.
You've developed small antlers or horns.

entries.name: Elemental Attunement
entries: You gain resistance to acid or cold damage. If you have darkvision you see in shades of blue. {@note 2}

entries.name: Cantrip
entries: You know one cantrip of your choice from: {@spell acid splash}, {@spell shape water}, {@spell frostbite}, {@spell ray of frost}, {@spell waterspout}. {@note 2}

entries.name: Elemental Magic
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can cast {@spell fog cloud}. Starting at 5th level, you can cast {@spell water walk} or {@spell become water}. {@note 7}

entries.name: Emissary of the Sea
entries: You can communicate simple ideas to any Beast, Elemental, or Monstrosity that has a swimming speed. They can understand the meaning of your words, though you have no special ability to understand them in return. {@note 1}

entries.name: Amphibious
entries: You can breathe both air and water. {@note 2}

entries.name: Swim Speed
entries: You have a swim speed of 30 feet. {@note 2}

entries.name: Swim Speed
entries: You have a swim speed of 30 feet. {@note 2}

entries.name: Amphibious
entries: You can breathe both air and water. {@note 2}

entries.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency with one tool of your choice: {@item carpenter's tools|XPHB}, {@item navigator's tools|XPHB}, or vehicles (water). {@note 1}

entries.name: Mariner's Lore
entries: Whenever you make an Intelligence ({@skill History}) or Intelligence ({@skill Religion}) check related to the sea or water vehicles, you are considered proficient with expertise in the History or Religion skill and add double your Proficiency Bonus to the check, instead of your normal Proficiency Bonus. {@note 1}

entries.name: Sea Legs
entries: You have advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) checks, and checks to be knocked prone when standing atop a vehicle. {@note 6}

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only in a monochromatic shade, usually gray. {@note 3}

entries.name: Emissary of the Sea
entries: You can communicate simple ideas to any Beast, Elemental, or Monstrosity that has a swimming speed. They can understand the meaning of your words, though you have no special ability to understand them in return. {@note 1}

entries.name: Elemental Magic
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can cast {@spell fog cloud} with this trait. Then starting at 5th level, you can cast {@spell water walk}. These spells do not require a material component, and can be cast once per long rest, or by using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level. {@note 7}

entries.name: Endurance
entries: You are acclimated to extreme climates and do not suffer the effects of deep waters below 100 ft. {@note 1}

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only in a monochromatic shade, usually gray. {@note 3}

entries.name: Emissary of the Sea
entries: You can communicate simple ideas to any Beast, Elemental, or Monstrosity that has a swimming speed. They can understand the meaning of your words, though you have no special ability to understand them in return. {@note 1}

entries.name: Endurance
entries: You are acclimated to extreme climates and do not suffer the effects of deep waters below 100 ft. {@note 1}

entries.name: Cantrip
entries: You know the {@spell dancing lights} cantrip. {@note 2}

entries.name: Natural Magic
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can cast {@spell aldricor's elemental rebuke|TheArenaGuy|elemental rebuke} with this trait. This spell does not require a material component, and can be cast once per long rest, or by using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level. {@note 3}

entries.name: Skill Proficiency
entries: You have proficiency in {@skill Perception}. {@note 2}

entries.name: Bite
entries: You can use your toothy maw to make unarmed strikes as a light weapon. When you hit with them, the strike deals 1d6 + your Strength modifier slashing damage. {@note 1}

entries.name: Aquatic Resistance
entries: You have resistance to cold damage. {@note 2}

entries.name: Emissary of the Sea
entries: You can communicate simple ideas to any Beast, Elemental, or Monstrosity that has a swimming speed. They can understand the meaning of your words, though you have no special ability to understand them in return. {@note 1}

entries.name: Defensive Feature
entries: When another creature grapples you or starts its turn grappling you, you can choose to use defensive features on your body to damage it. You deal damage equal to {@damage 1d4} × your Proficiency Bonus of the damage type chosen. {@note 4}

entries.name: Natural Armor
entries: You have thick skin. Your AC is 12 + your Constitution modifier. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor. {@note 3}

entries.name: Weather Worn
entries: You do not suffer disadvantage on perception checks due to heavy precipitation and wind, or areas lightly obscured by mist, light fog, silty, or choppy water. {@note 0}

entries.name: Chitinous Pincers
entries: You can use your clawed hand to make unarmed strikes as a light weapon. When you hit with it, the strike deals 1d6 + your Strength modifier slashing damage. {@note 1}

entries.name: Acclimatization
entries: You are acclimated to extreme climates and do not suffer the effects of extreme cold below 0 degrees Fahrenheit. {@note 0}

entries.name: Carapace
entries: Due to your chitinous exoskeleton and the shape of your body, you are ill-suited to wearing armor. Your form provides ample protection, however; it gives you a base AC of 17 (your Dexterity modifier doesn't affect this number). You gain no benefit from wearing armor, but if you are using a shield, you can apply the shield's bonus as normal. At level 12, the base AC of your shell increases to 18 due to your combat experience. {@note 5}

entries.name: Emissary of the Sea
entries: You can communicate simple ideas to any Beast, Elemental, or Monstrosity that has a swimming speed. They can understand the meaning of your words, though you have no special ability to understand them in return. {@note 1}

entries.name: Aquatic Resistance
entries: You have resistance to one of the following damage types: acid or cold. {@note 2}

entries.name: Ice Skate
entries: You can walk across the surface of water as if it were solid ground, your footsteps temporarily freezing it, with the ice melting the instant your foot moves. Walking across difficult terrain caused by ice or snow costs you no extra movement. {@note 3}

entries.name: Amphibious
entries: You can breathe both air and water. {@note 2}

entries.name: Water
entries: You gain resistance to acid or cold damage. If you have darkvision you see in shades of blue. You speak primordial (aquan). {@note 2}

entries.name: Cantrip
entries: You know one cantrip of your choice associated with your elemental attunement: {@spell black ice|spellsthatdontsuck}, {@spell ice weapon|KT-CLL}, {@spell frostbite|XGE}, {@spell ray of frost}. {@note 2}

entries.name: Elemental Magic
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can cast one spell associated with your elemental attunement: {@spell arctic breath|KT-CLL}, {@spell frost shuriken|spellsthatdontsuck}, {@spell ice arrow|KT-CLL}, {@spell entomb|KT-CLL}.

Then starting at 5th level, you can cast one spell associated with your elemental attunement: {@spell Rime's binding ice|FTD|binding ice}, {@spell cold snap|spellsthatdontsuck}. These spells do not require a material component, and can be cast once per long rest, or by using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level. {@note 7}

Arising from the Frostfell - the permafrost-coated border of the Planes of Air and Water - born to air and water genasi parents, or altered in the womb by exposure to the power of djinn and marids, an ice genasi results from the metaphysical combination of their two elements: the stillness of open air meeting the destructive power of roiling waters. They can freeze the water and air around them, launch deadly icicles from their hands, and chill their enemies to the bone.

Iceborn generally have skin with mortal hues overlaid with the blues, purples, and whites of a frozen corpse. They have spiky hair resembling cascading stalagmites and stalactites made of pure ice, and eyes whose color cycles through the soft iridescence of an aurora in a wintry night sky. They are often covered in a thin layer of frost that billows off as powder snow when they move, and are almost disconcertingly cold to the touch, as if they produce no body heat.

entries.name: Brew the Toxin
entries: You know the {@spell poison spray} cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast either the {@spell ray of sickness}, {@spell nauseating poison|KT-CLL}, or {@spell sleep} spell with this trait (you choose the spell you can cast with this trait when you reach 3rd level), without requiring a material component. Starting at 5th level, you can cast the {@spell stinking cloud} spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Once you cast the chosen spell or stinking cloud with this trait, you can't cast that spell with this trait again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Poison Resilience
entries: You have advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the {@condition poisoned} condition on yourself. You also have resistance to poison damage.

Poison genasi bear the metaphysical connection of Fire and Water, the burn of fire with the flow of water to create a substance that scorches through veins and organs. Born to genasi of those elements or to mortals through the ambient magic of efreeti and marids, poison genasi bodies act as cauldrons in which virulent toxins are brewed and expelled.

A poison genasi's skin generally has a strong, vivid coloration, with distinctive stripes or splotches of dark or other bright hues. Their hair often has a mortal coloration, though it may also be a bright, translucent, striated, or ombre hue of a distinct color to their skin. Their eyes are usually darkly colored, either in mortal tones or a deep black that makes the pupil nearly indistinguishable from the iris.

entries.name: Poison Resistance
entries: You have resistance to poison damage. {@note 2}

entries.name: Quick
entries: Your base walking speed is 35 feet. {@note 2}

entries.name: Survivalist
entries: You only need to consume half as much food and drink as a normal person. {@note 1}

entries.name: Relentless
entries: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest. {@note 4}

entries.name: Poison Resistance
entries: You have resistance to poison damage. {@note 2}

entries.name: Speech of Beast and Leaf
entries: You have the ability to communicate in a limited manner with Beasts, Plants, and vegetation. They can understand the meaning of your words, though you have no special ability to understand them in return. You have advantage on all Charisma checks you make to influence them. {@note 2}

entries.name: Keen Senses
entries: You have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or sight. {@note 6}

entries.name: Speech of Beast and Leaf
entries: You have the ability to communicate in a limited manner with Beasts, Plants, and vegetation. They can understand the meaning of your words, though you have no special ability to understand them in return. You have advantage on all Charisma checks you make to influence them. {@note 2}

entries.name: Cantrip
entries: You know the {@spell druidcraft} or {@spell shillelagh} cantrip. {@note 2}

entries.name: Elemental Magic
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can choose one spell {@spell ensnaring strike}, {@spell entangle}, {@spell grasping roots|KT-CLL}, or {@spell bramble binding|KT-CLL}, that you can cast with this trait.

Then starting at 5th level, you can cast {@spell sprout tree|KT-CLL} or {@spell lashing vine|spellsthatdontsuck}. These spells do not require a material component, and can be cast once per long rest, or by using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level. {@note 7}

entries.name: Spore Strike
entries: When you damage a creature with an attack, you can cause the attack to deal an extra poison or acid damage equal to your Proficiency Bonus, and give Disadvantage to the next ability check or saving throw the target makes until the start of your next turn. This trait can be used a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus per long rest. {@note 3}

entries.name: Charm Resistance
entries: You have advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the {@condition charmed} condition on yourself. {@note 2}

entries.name: Cantrip
entries: You know the {@spell message}, {@spell preservation|KT-CLL}, {@spell decaying touch|KT-CLL}, or {@spell corpselight|DMM} cantrip. If you choose mage hand, the hand is invisible and doesn't require components when you cast it with this trait. {@note 2}

entries.name: Spore Network
entries: At 3rd level, you can cast one spell from the following list {@spell cause fear|XGE}, {@spell charm person}, {@spell psychadelics|VSS}, or {@spell find in nature|spellsthatdontsuck}, without requiring a material component. This spell can be cast once per long rest, or by using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.

entries.name: Cantrip
entries: You know one cantrip of your choice associated with your elemental attunement: {@spell infestation}, {@spell druidcraft}, {@spell thought wisp}, or {@spell thorn whip}. {@note 2}

entries.name: Elemental Magic
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can cast one spell associated with your elemental attunement: {@spell hail of thorns}, {@spell magic fruit|spellsthatdontsuck}, or {@spell calm emotions}.

Then starting at 5th level, you can cast one spell associated with your elemental attunement: {@spell plant growth}, {@spell petal storm}, {@spell spike growth}, or {@spell wither and bloom}. These spells do not require a material component, and can be cast once per long rest, or by using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level. {@note 7}

entries.name: Speech of Beast and Leaf
entries: You have the ability to communicate in a limited manner with Beasts, Plants, and vegetation. They can understand the meaning of your words, though you have no special ability to understand them in return. You have advantage on all Charisma checks you make to influence them. {@note 2}

entries.name: Spore Ward
entries: You can't be put to sleep against your will, and you have advantage on saving throws you make to resist or end the {@condition poisoned} condition on yourself. {@note 2}

entries.name: Hunter's Senses
entries: Thanks to your keen sense of smell, you have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}), Wisdom ({@skill Survival}), and Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) checks that involve smell. As an action you can focus your sense of smell and gain blindsight (30 ft.) until the end of your next turn. {@note 7}

entries.name: Keen Smell
entries: Thanks to your keen sense of smell, you have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}), Wisdom ({@skill Survival}), and Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) checks that involve smell. {@note 3}

entries.name: Trap Master
entries: You have a preternatural ability to avoid traps and have advantage on Dexterity or Strength saves against triggered traps. {@note 1}

entries.name: Poison Resistance
entries: You are resistant to poison damage. {@note 3}

entries.name: Keen Smell
entries: Thanks to your keen sense of smell, you have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}), Wisdom ({@skill Survival}), and Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) checks that involve smell. {@note 3}

entries.name: Skilled Agriculturalist
entries: You have proficiency on Nature (Wisdom) checks, proficiency with the {@item sickle|phb}, and advantage on any checks made to farm, forage, or harvest. {@note 2}

entries.name: Cute
entries: You have half-proficiency in {@skill Persuasion} and {@skill Deception} checks. The first time you interact with strangers in an unfamiliar land, culture, or region, add {@dice 1d4} to the first {@skill Persuasion}, {@skill Deception}, or {@skill Performance} check you make against them. This trait does not work on groups if at least one person in the group knows you. {@note 2}

entries.name: Quick
entries: Your base walking speed is 35 feet. {@note 2}

entries.name: Bounding
entries: As a bonus action, you can jump a number of feet equal to five times your proficiency bonus, without provoking opportunity attacks. You can use this trait only if your speed is greater than 0. You can use it a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
Additionally, the efficiency of movement your bounding provides means you can move twice the normal time (up to 16 hours) each day before being subject to the effects of a forced march. {@note 4}

entries.name: Lucky
entries: When you roll a 1 on an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll. {@note 4}

entries.name: Socializer
entries: The first time you interact with strangers in an unfamiliar land, culture, or region, add {@dice 1d4} to the first Charisma (Persuasion or Deception) check you make against them. This trait does not work on groups if at least one person in the group knows you. {@note 0}

entries.name: Strong Kick
entries: You have one or more features that allow you to make damaging unarmed strikes as a natural, light weapon. When you hit with it, the strike deals {@damage 1d6} + Strength modifier bludgeoning damage. {@note 1}

entries.name: Traversal
entries: You can move across difficult terrain without expending extra movement if you are using your walking speed and are on the ground or floor. {@note 1}

entries.name: Climb Speed
entries: You have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed. {@note 2}

entries.name: Leap
entries: Your long jump is 20 feet and your high jump is 10 feet, with or without a running start. {@note 2}

entries.name: Combat Awareness
entries: If you are surprised in battle, enemies do not have advantage against you in the surprise round. {@note 0}

entries.name: Cat's Talent
entries: You have proficiency with the {@skill Perception} and {@skill Stealth} skills. {@note 2}

entries.name: Adrenaline Rush
entries: You can take the {@action Dash} action as a bonus action. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus per long rest. Whenever you use this trait, gain a number of temporary hit points equal to your Proficiency Bonus. {@note 3}

entries.name: Roar
entries: As a bonus action, you can let out an especially menacing roar. Creatures of your choice within 10 feet of you that can hear you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of you until the end of your next turn. The DC of the save equals 8 + your Proficiency Bonus + your Constitution modifier. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest. {@note 2}

entries.name: Swiftness
entries: When you move on your turn in combat, you can double your speed until the end of the turn. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you move 0 feet on one of your turns. {@note 2}

entries.name: Combat Climber
entries: Your techniques allow you to fight as you climb. You can Climb with a hand occupied. You must still use another hand and both legs to Climb. {@note 0}

entries.name: Hunter's Instincts
entries: You have proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: Athletics, Intimidation, Perception, or Survival. {@note 2}

entries.name: Brave
entries: You have advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the {@condition frightened} condition on yourself. {@note 2}

entries.name: Lucky
entries: When you roll a 1 on an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll. {@note 4}

entries.name: Brave
entries: You have advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the {@condition frightened} condition on yourself. {@note 2}

entries.name: Shadow Magic
entries: Beginning at 3rd level, you can cast one 1st-level spell of your choice from the illusion or necromancy schools of magic. {@note 2}

entries.name: Elemental Attunement, Earth
entries: You know the {@spell stone forming|KT-CLL} or {@spell manipulate earth|spellsthatdontsuck} cantrip. {@note 2}

entries.name: Unending Breath
entries: You can hold your breath indefinitely while you're not {@condition incapacitated}. {@note 1}

entries.name: Elemental Strike, Earth
entries: When you damage a creature with an attack, you can cause a target no more than one size larger than you to make your choice of a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) or Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check to avoid being knocked {@condition prone}. This trait can be used a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus per long rest. {@note 3}

entries.name: Elemental Magic, Earth
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can cast one spell associated with your elemental attunement: {@spell absorb elements}, {@spell earth tremor}, {@spell expeditious retreat}, {@spell longstrider}, {@spell shield of faith} (self only).
Then starting at 5th level, you can cast one spell associated with your elemental attunement: {@spell dust devil}, {@spell earthbind}, {@spell earthen grasp}, {@spell heat metal}. {@note 7}

entries.name: Natural Armor
entries: You have thick skin. Your AC is 12 + your Constitution modifier. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor. {@note 3}

entries.name: Elemental Attunement, Metal
entries: You know the {@spell blade ward} cantrip and can cast it normally or as a bonus action a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, replenishing on a long rest. If you have darkvision you see in shades of a color of your choice. You speak primordial (terran). {@note 2}

entries.name: Metal Skin
entries: You can use your metal heritage to defend yourself. As a bonus action, you can enhance the metal in your body by turning your skin into metal: this process heals 1hp per level and provides you with resistance to all damage till the beginning of your next turn. A long rest is required to regain this power. {@note 1}

entries.name: Toxin Resilience
entries: You have advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the {@condition poisoned} or {@condition diseased} conditions on yourself. {@note 2}

entries.name: Combat Climber
entries: Your techniques allow you to fight as you climb. You can Climb with a hand occupied. You must still use another hand and both legs to Climb. {@note 0}

entries.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency with {@item smith's tools}. {@note 1}

entries.name: Charge
entries: Immediately after you use the {@action Dash} action on your turn and move at least 20 feet, you can make one unarmed strike melee attack as a bonus action, or you can ram a target and attempt to knock it {@condition prone}. The DC for this Strength saving throw is equal to 8 + your Strength modifier + your Proficiency Bonus. {@note 3}

entries.name: Golden Bulwark
entries: Your form lets you shrug off damage. You know the {@spell blade ward} cantrip and can cast it normally or as a bonus action a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, replenishing on a long rest. It takes only somatic components.
Starting at 5th level, you may cast {@spell liquid armor|VSS} once per day on a creature other than yourself, replenishing on a long rest. {@note 5}

entries.name: Metallic Appendage
entries: You form part of your body into a weapon-like appendage able to make damaging unarmed strikes as a light weapon. When you hit with it, the strike deals {@damage 1d6} + Strength modifier damage. You pick whether the damage is slashing, piercing, or bludgeoning based on the form you create. {@note 1}

entries.name: Metal Skin
entries: You can use your metal heritage to defend yourself. As a bonus action, you can enhance the metal in your body by turning your skin into metal: this process grants you temporary HP equal to your Constitution modifier + 1 per level for the next 10 minutes, and provides you with resistance to all damage till the beginning of your next turn. A long rest is required to regain this power. {@note 4}

entries.name: Toxin Resilience
entries: You have advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the {@condition poisoned} or {@condition diseased} conditions on yourself. {@note 2}

entries.name: Combat Climber
entries: Your techniques allow you to fight as you climb. You can Climb with a hand occupied. You must still use another hand and both legs to Climb. {@note 0}

entries.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency with {@item smith's tools}. {@note 1}

entries.name: Charge
entries: Immediately after you use the {@action Dash} action on your turn and move at least 20 feet, you can make one unarmed strike melee attack as a bonus action, or you can ram a target and attempt to knock it {@condition prone}. The DC for this Strength saving throw is equal to 8 + your Strength modifier + your Proficiency Bonus. {@note 3}

entries.name: Natural Armor
entries: You can calculate your AC as 13 + your Dexterity modifier. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor. {@note 3}

entries.name: Chromatic Magic
entries: You can cast {@spell color spray}. You can also cast {@spell chromatic orb} in the element matching your attunement as a melee spell attack. Beginning at 3rd level you can use this trait a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus per long rest to cast either of these spells, or cast them normally using spell slots. {@note 4}

entries.name: Constructed Form
entries: You are a Construct. You don't need to eat, drink, or breathe, and magic can't put you to sleep. You are immune to disease and have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition paralyzed}. {@note 4}

entries.name: Psionic Resistance, Psychic
entries: You have resistance to psychic damage. {@note 3}

entries.name: Empathic
entries: You have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) checks made to discern the emotions of others. {@note 1}

entries.name: Serenity
entries: You have advantage on saving throws to avoid or end the {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} conditions on yourself, and to resist the effects of madness. {@note 4}

entries.name: Necrotic Resistance
entries: You have resistance to necrotic damage. {@note 3}

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only in a monochromatic shade of the type of ooze you are associated with. {@note 3}

entries.name: Touch of Decay
entries: You know the {@spell chill touch} or {@spell decaying touch|KT-CLL} cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell inflict wounds} or {@spell grip of the dead|KT-CLL} spell with this trait. Starting at 5th level, you can cast the {@spell wrack|GHLoE} or {@spell dust cyclone|spellsthatdontsuck} spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. If you cast dust cyclone with this trait, you can choose for it to deal necrotic damage, instead of bludgeoning, for the duration. Once you cast a spell with this trait, you can't cast that spell with this trait again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level. {@note 9}

entries.name: Unending Breath
entries: You can hold your breath indefinitely while you're not incapacitated. {@note 1}

Dust genasi, sometimes called sand or even salt genasi, have a connection to the elements of Earth and Air. Their magic manifests as a combination of their elements' physical properties: thick clouds of silica particles that flow through the air at the genasi's command, and seem to absorb moisture and possibly even life force from those they touch, grinding away at whatever it touches until it decays into dust. For this reason, many cultures that are aware of the existence of dust genasi fear their touch, either not knowing that the genasi has full control of their deadly magic or fearing how the genasi might use it.

Dust genasi almost always appear emaciated and malnourished, as though their magic is eating them from the inside. While their skin, eyes, and hair can have any mortal hue, they appear desaturated of color, perhaps even having a yellow, tan, or gray caste. Their hair is thin and wispy, almost constantly being whipped about by a phantom cyclone. When a creature sees a dust genasi from their peripheral vision, the genasi's skin and flesh may appear to blow away as particles similar in appearance to their cloud, appearing to leave only animate bone, though looking directly at the genasi or looking away proves this to have been only a trick of the mind.

entries.name: Heart of the Forge
entries: You know the {@spell green-flame blade|TCOE} cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell searing smite} spell with this trait. Starting at 5th level, you can cast the {@spell heat metal} spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Once you cast searing smite or heat metal with this trait, you can't cast that spell with this trait again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (choose when you select this race). {@note 9}

entries.name: Metallic Skin
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to Armor Class. {@note 7}

A metal genasi's magic comes from the metaphysical combination of Earth and Fire, the purifying properties of fire augmenting the enduring properties of earth. Unlike most other types of genasi, metal genasi can't summon or shape their mixed element quite so much as channel their magic through it, oft excelling in the use of metal implements. Many feel most at home near a blacksmith's forge or with a metal weapon in their hands, leading the vast majority of metal genasi to enter a vocation of smithing or warfare.

It's common for those unfamiliar with metal genasi to initially mistake them for azers or constructs; a metal genasi's skin and hair are almost always glistening metallic tones, such as iron, steel, gold, or bronze, though any type of metal is possible. More often than not, their skin is of a type of metal, and their hair and nails an alloy of that metal, though both their skin and hair are nearly as flexible as any other mortal's. Metal genasi irises, though, burn with an intensity reminiscent of a forge's flame, generally in reds, greens, blues, oranges, or yellows, or even white hot.

entries.name: Swim Speed
entries: You have a swim speed of 30 feet provided you are not wearing medium or heavy armor. {@note 2}

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only in a monochromatic shade of the type of ooze you are associated with. {@note 3}

entries.name: Acid Resistance
entries: You have resistance to acid damage. {@note 2}

entries.name: Play with Mud
entries: You know the {@spell acid splash} cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell grease} spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Starting at 5th level, you can cast the {@spell Melf's acid arrow} spell, without requiring a material component. Once you cast grease or Melf's acid arrow with this trait, you can't cast that spell with this trait again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (choose when you select this race). {@note 7}

entries.name: Slippery Skin
entries: You have advantage on any ability check or saving throw you make to avoid or end the {@condition grappled} or {@condition restrained} condition on yourself. {@note 5}

The Swamp of Oblivion is a colloquial name given to the Paraelemental Plane of Ooze, where the Planes of Earth and Water meet to form an enormous bog of acidic mud and slime that eats away at the planar borders almost as quickly as they can renew themselves. Whether born in the Swamp or to an earth and water genasi parental pair, or imbued by dao and marid magics in the womb, ooze genasi wield the physical mixture of their two elemental connections: skin coated in slippery muck, as well as the ability to summon and manipulate the corrosive substances that pervade the Swamp of Oblivion.

Usually, an ooze genasi's skin has mortal tones, though it secretes a layer of slime or moist mud that varies in thickness based on stress and causes their skin to appear oily with a green or brown tint. It is common for a community to mistake an ooze genasi with a mud coating as a separate type of genasi, referring to them as mud genasi. No matter which coating an ooze genasi's skin has, their hair appears in mortal or brackish hues, and easily becomes greasy if it isn't washed with incredible frequency. Similarly, their eyes are often a muddy brown or oily green.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only in a monochromatic shade, usually gray. {@note 3}

entries.name: Strong Bite
entries: Your toothy maw can make damaging unarmed strikes as a light weapon. When you hit with it, the strike deals {@damage 1d6} + Strength modifier slashing damage. {@note 1}

entries.name: Defensive Feature, Spines
entries: When another creature {@condition grappled||grapples} you or starts its turn grappling you, you can choose to use defensive features on your body to damage it. You deal piercing damage equal to {@damage 1d4} × your Proficiency Bonus. {@note 4}

entries.name: Climb Speed
entries: You have a climbing speed of 30 feet. {@note 2}

entries.name: Leap
entries: Your long jump is 20 feet and your high jump is 10 feet, with or without a running start. {@note 2}

entries.name: Acclimatization
entries: You are acclimated to extreme climates and do not suffer the effects of extreme heat above 100 degrees Fahrenheit. {@note 0}

entries.name: Hold Breath
entries: You can hold your breath for up to 1 hour at a time. {@note 1}

entries.name: Survivalist
entries: You only need to consume half as much food and drink as a normal person. {@note 1}

entries.name: Skilled Tracker
entries: Whenever you make a Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) check to track creatures, you have advantage on that check. {@note 2}

entries.name: Hold Breath
entries: You can hold your breath for up to 1 hour at a time. {@note 1}

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only in a monochromatic shade, usually gray. {@note 3}

entries.name: Natural Weapons
entries: Your toothy maw and/or strong tail allow you to make damaging unarmed strikes as a light weapon. When you hit with it, the strike deals:
{@note 1}

entries.name: Hungry Jaws
entries: As a bonus action, you can make a special attack with your bite. If the attack hits, it deals normal damage, and you gain temporary hit points (minimum of 1) equal to your Proficiency Bonus. This trait can be used a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus per long rest. {@note 3}

entries.name: Natural Armor
entries: You can calculate your AC as 13 + your Dexterity modifier. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor. {@note 3}

entries.name: Weather Worn
entries: You do not suffer disadvantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks due to heavy precipitation and wind, or areas lightly obscured by mist, light fog, or water conditions. {@note 1}

entries.name: Swim Speed
entries: You have a swim speed of 30 feet provided you are not wearing medium or heavy armor. {@note 2}

entries.name: Skill Proficiency
entries: You have proficiency in {@skill Intimidation}. {@note 2}

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray. {@note 3}

entries.name: Chromatophore
entries: As a bonus action, you can turn invisible until the start of your next turn. This effect ends early if you make an attack roll or force a creature to make a saving throw. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus per long rest. {@note 6}

entries.name: Tongue
entries: Your tongue can make damaging unarmed strikes as a light weapon with a reach of 10 feet. When you hit with it, the strike deals {@damage 1d6} + Strength modifier bludgeoning damage. {@note 3}

entries.name: Climb Speed
entries: You have a climbing speed of 30 feet. {@note 2}

entries.name: Skill Proficiency
entries: You have proficiency in {@skill Stealth}. {@note 2}

entries.name: Quick
entries: Your base walking speed is 35 feet. {@note 2}

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only in a monochromatic shade, usually gray. {@note 3}

entries.name: Acclimatization
entries: You are acclimated to extreme climates and do not suffer the effects of extreme heat above 100 degrees Fahrenheit. {@note 0}

entries.name: Tooth and Tail
entries: Your toothy maw can make damaging unarmed strikes as a light weapon. When you hit with it, the strike deals {@damage 1d6} + Strength modifier slashing damage. {@note 1}

entries.name: Natural Armor
entries: You can calculate your AC as 13 + your Dexterity modifier. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor. {@note 3}

entries.name: Burrow
entries: At 1st level, you can use your bonus action to gain a burrow speed of 10 feet for one turn. At 5th level, your burrow speed increases to 20 feet. {@note 5}

entries.name: Tooth and Tail
entries: Your toothy maw and/or strong tail allow you to make damaging unarmed strikes as a light weapon. When you hit with it, the strike deals: {@note 1}

entries.name: Regeneration
entries: As a bonus action, you can heal wounds you have taken. You may spend a hit die to regain that much health a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus per long rest. {@note 4}

entries.name: Beast Tracker
entries: Whenever you make a Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) check to track beasts, you are considered proficient in the Survival skill and add double your Proficiency Bonus to the check, instead of your normal Proficiency Bonus. {@note 1}

entries.name: Toxin Resilience
entries: You have advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the {@condition poisoned} or {@condition diseased} conditions on yourself. {@note 2}

entries.name: Poison Resistance
entries: You are resistant to poison damage. {@note 3}

entries.name: Bite
entries: You can use your toothy maw to make unarmed strikes as a light weapon. When you hit with them, the strike deals {@damage 1d6} + your Strength modifier slashing damage. {@note 1}

entries.name: Shell
entries: Due to your shell and the shape of your body, you are ill-suited to wearing armor. Your body provides ample protection, however; it gives you a base AC of 17 (your Dexterity modifier doesn't affect this number). You gain no benefit from wearing armor, but if you are using a shield, you can apply the shield's bonus as normal. At level 12, the base AC of your shell increases to 18 due to your combat experience. {@note 5}

entries.name: Swim Speed
entries: You have a swim speed of 30 feet provided you are not wearing medium or heavy armor. {@note 2}

entries.name: Durable
entries: When you take damage, you can use your reaction to roll {@damage 1d12} + your Constitution modifier and reduce the damage by that total. This trait can be used a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus per long rest. {@note 7}

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries: You have advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic. {@note 6}

entries.name: Tinkerer
entries: You know the Mending and {@spell Prestidigitation} cantrips. In addition, you can spend 10 minutes casting Prestidigitation to create a Tiny clockwork device (AC 5, 1 HP), such as a toy, fire starter, or music box. When you create the device, you determine its function by choosing one effect from Prestidigitation; the device produces that effect whenever you or another creature takes a Bonus Action to activate it with a touch. If the chosen effect has options within it, you choose one of those options for the device when you create it. For example, if you choose the spell's ignite-extinguish effect, you determine whether the device ignites or extinguishes fire; the device doesn't do both. You can have three such devices in existence at a time, and each falls apart 8 hours after its creation or when you dismantle it with a touch as a Utilize action. {@note 0}

entries.name: Artisan's Lore
entries: Whenever you make an Intelligence ({@skill History}) check related to the origin or history of an item related to an artisan tool with which you are proficient, you are considered proficient in the History skill and add double your Proficiency Bonus to the check, instead of your normal Proficiency Bonus. {@note 0}

entries.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency with the artisan's tools of your choice. {@note 1}

entries.name: Skilled Artistry
entries: The time it takes to craft something using an artisan's tool with which you are proficient is halved. {@note 2}

entries.name: Greater Magic Resistance
entries: You have advantage on all saving throws against magic. {@note 9}

entries.name: Socializer
entries: The first time you interact with strangers in an unfamiliar land, culture, or region, add {@dice 1d4} to the first {@skill Persuasion}, {@skill Deception}, or {@skill Performance} check you make against them. This trait does not work on groups if at least one person in the group knows you. {@note 0}

entries.name: Cantrip
entries: You know the {@spell dancing lights}, {@spell druidcraft}, {@spell friends}, {@spell minor illusion}, or {@spell vicious mockery} cantrip. {@note 2}

entries.name: Fey Magic
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can cast one spell from the following list: {@spell animal friendship}, {@spell cause fear}, {@spell charm person}, {@spell disguise self}, {@spell enlarge/reduce}, {@spell faerie fire}, {@spell tasha's hideous laughter|phb|hideous laughter}, {@spell sleep}. {@note 2}

entries.name: Greater Magic Resistance
entries: You have advantage on all saving throws against magic. {@note 9}

entries.name: Beast Tracker
entries: Whenever you make a Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) check to track beasts, you are considered proficient in the Survival skill and add double your Proficiency Bonus to the check, instead of your normal Proficiency Bonus. {@note 1}

entries.name: Speech of Beast and Leaf
entries: You have the ability to communicate in a limited manner with Beasts, Plants, and vegetation. They can understand the meaning of your words, though you have no special ability to understand them in return. You have advantage on all Charisma checks you make to influence them. {@note 2}

entries.name: Out of Sight
entries: You can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by foliage, rocky terrain, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena, and have advantage on these Dexterity checks. {@note 1}

entries.name: Greater Magic Resistance
entries: You have advantage on all saving throws against magic. {@note 9}

entries.name: Swim Speed
entries: You have a swim speed of 30 feet provided you are not wearing medium or heavy armor. {@note 2}

entries.name: Fishermen's Tales
entries: Whenever you make an Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) or Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) check related to the sea or other bodies of water, you are considered proficient in the Insight or Survival skill and add double your Proficiency Bonus to the check, instead of your normal Proficiency Bonus. {@note 1}

entries.name: Weather Worn
entries: You do not suffer disadvantage on perception checks due to heavy precipitation and wind, or areas lightly obscured by mist, light fog, or water conditions. {@note 1}

entries.name: Greater Magic Resistance
entries: You have advantage on all saving throws against magic. {@note 9}

entries.name: Telepathy
entries: You can speak telepathically to any creature within 30 feet of you. The creature understands you only if the two of you share a language. You can speak telepathically in this way to one creature at a time. {@note 5}
